meanings.definition: The quality or state of being jejune.
meanings.sent1: The jejunenesses of the story made it hard to stay engaged.
meanings.sent2: Her writing often suffers from jejunenesses, lacking depth and complexity.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the jejunenesses of the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent4: The jejunenesses of his arguments left his audience unconvinced.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful visuals to illustrate the concept of jejunenesses.

meanings.definition: Lack of interest or significance; shallowness.
meanings.sent1: The jejunenesses of the movie made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: His speech was filled with jejunenesses, failing to capture the audience's attention.
meanings.sent3: She rolled her eyes at the jejunenesses of the gossip magazines.
meanings.sent4: The party had an air of jejunenesses, lacking any excitement or energy.
meanings.sent5: The painting's jejunenesses left viewers feeling unimpressed and uninterested.

meanings.sent1: The jejunenesses of his behavior was evident in his childish tantrums.
meanings.sent2: The student's essay was full of jejunenesses, lacking any real analysis.
meanings.sent3: The team's jejunenesses on the field cost them the game.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was filled with jejunenesses, showing her lack of experience.
meanings.sent5: The book's jejunenesses made it difficult to take the plot seriously.
